poem:
**Silent Prices**

In the cradle of need—  
an empty tin,  
a mother's quiet worry  
whispers among aisles,  
as coins drop like  
unheard rain.  
Paused remedies—  
the price of milk  
climbs higher,  
stretching its shadow  
over tomorrow.  
Yet, a child, unaware,  
cradles a different  
kind of hunger,  
beneath the noise  
of rising numbers.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Baby formula prices at historic high despite UK watchdog proposals Baby formula prices remain close to historic highs more than 18 months after the UK competition watchdog began an investigation into the market, with the government a week late in responding to its proposed remedies. The cost of infant formula fell only 50p on average last year, to £11.99 a tin, compared with £11.10 in 2021, with the most expensive priced at £18. The products". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
